body: IMHO we should replace the existing methods with methods accepting the device ID, i.e. we should change the clients' underlying sender link to be always scoped to the tenant instead of the device.

@sophokles73 For the `AsyncCommandClient` class this looks like the straightforward solution.

For the `CommandClient` class however, we have to take into account that there is a command response receiver link *scoped on the device* being opened there. This requires some more thought.

With the `CommandClientImpl` being an `AbstractHonoClient` with one `ProtonSender` and one `ProtonReceiver` we would have to override quite some of the base class functionality in order to handle multiple *device-scoped* command response receiver links (not opening and closing them on every `sendCommand`). I would rather keep the `CommandClientImpl` device-scoped, but handle re-use of the tenant-scoped command sender link via the `ApplicationClientFactory` (on which `getOrCreateCommandClient` is to be called).
isn't the intended behavior of the CommandClient the one that we already have in all the other Device Registry clients i.e. using a single set of sender and receiver links for multiple requests?

Yes, the CommandClient would have a single device-scoped Command receiver link and the tenant-scoped Command sender link, provided by and shared via the  ApplicationClientFactory / CommandClientFactory instance. Both would be used for multiple requests. Or what have you been aiming at?
Well, I would not call it *scoped to a single device* but rather *scoped to a single UUID* generated on instantiation, right?

issue.title: [#1073] Change northbound control endpoint names
issue.body:
This is for #1073:
> The recently introduced `control/${tenant_id}` endpoint (providing the gateway mapping feature) is renamed to `control_request/${tenant_id}`.
> For the command reply address, the pattern `control_response/${tenant_id}/${reply_id}` is now used by default. The old pattern `control/${tenant_id}/${reply_id}` is still supported as legacy control endpoint.

*EDIT:*
The recently introduced `control/${tenant_id}` endpoint (providing the gateway mapping feature) is renamed to `command_request/${tenant_id}`.
For the command reply address, the pattern `command_response/${tenant_id}/${reply_id}` is now used by default. The old pattern `control/${tenant_id}/${reply_id}` is still supported as legacy control endpoint.

body:
Right, the command response receiver links are indeed scoped to the `replyId` - which may be an ID shared between commands for *different* devices. 

In that sense the `CommandClient` instance can indeed keep just *one* command response receiver link to handle commands for multiple devices.

So yes, we can add a `deviceId` param to the `CommandClient#sendCommand` methods and refactor the `AbstractRequestResponseClient` base class a bit to support setting a request messages address per request.

issue.title: [#1255] Let CommandClient instance be scoped to a tenant
issue.body:
This is for #1255.

With this PR, the `CommandClient` is scoped to a tenant, not a device anymore. The device id is given as a parameter to the individual `sendCommand` invocation.

Note: The `AsyncCommandClient` is not changed here - this will come in a follow-up commit.
